title: Deep Indigo + Inter global identity and Topbar logo replacement

requirements.summary: Add new logo static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated with stable, UI-friendly filenames.
acceptanceCriteria: The repository contains new logo assets in frontend/public/assets/generated.
The filenames are stable and referenced consistently by the UI (no direct references to the raw upload filename in JSX).

file_operations.description: Add the newly generated square logo mark (transparent background) as a static asset with a stable filename for UI references.
Add the newly generated horizontal wordmark (transparent background) as a static asset with a stable filename for UI references.

requirements.summary: Update the global header (Topbar) to render the new logo asset(s) and keep alignment within the 64px header height.
acceptanceCriteria: The Topbar no longer renders /assets/generated/firsty-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png and /assets/generated/firsty-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png; it renders the new logo asset(s) instead.
The header layout remains visually aligned (logo fits within the existing 64px header height without overflow).

file_operations.description: Replace the current logo sources with the new static assets at frontend/public/assets/generated/fy-logo-mark.dim_512x512.png and frontend/public/assets/generated/fy-wordmark.dim_1200x300.png; ensure sizing stays within the existing h-16 header (e.g., keep mark ~32px and wordmark ~24px tall) and maintain alignment/gap.

requirements.summary: Apply the Deep Indigo palette globally via Tailwind/Shadcn theme variables with high contrast and restrained Sage accent usage.
acceptanceCriteria: Primary actions, active navigation states, and key highlights use the Deep Indigo primary color.
Accent color (Sage Green) appears only in small highlight/accent contexts (e.g., badges, subtle indicators), not as dominant surfaces.
Text/background contrast remains readable in light mode across key screens (e.g., Login, Dashboard, Documents, Settings).

file_operations.description: Update global CSS theme variables to match the provided palette: Deep Indigo (#1A2B4C) as primary, Slate Gray (#3E4A59) for foreground/body text, Ice White (#F4F7F9) for backgrounds, and Sage Green (#7A918D) for accent only; also adjust any chart/support tokens to avoid neon/pink/purple hues and preserve readable contrast in light mode.

Align Tailwind color tokens with the updated theme variable strategy (e.g., ensure primary/foreground/background/muted/accent are derived from the CSS variables used by Shadcn) so components consistently pick up the new palette across the app.

requirements.summary: Set Inter as the default sans-serif font and enforce typography hierarchy (titles semibold, subtitles medium, body regular).
acceptanceCriteria: Inter is loaded by the frontend (e.g., via index.html or CSS) and used as the default sans-serif font throughout the app.
Headings/titles render with semibold weight, subtitles with medium weight, and body text with regular weight (verified on at least Login and one internal page such as Dashboard).

file_operations.description: Load the Inter font (e.g., via a font provider link tag) with weights 400 (regular), 500 (medium), and 600 (semibold) so it is available globally.
Set Inter as the default sans font family in Tailwind theme configuration so all `font-sans` usage defaults to Inter throughout the app.

Apply global typography defaults: set the appâ€™s base font-family to Inter and establish a hierarchy where titles/headings are semibold, subtitle patterns are medium, and body text defaults to regular weight (using @layer base rules without modifying shadcn/ui components).
Adjust title/subtitle class usage so the Login page clearly reflects the hierarchy (CardTitle semibold; CardDescription/subtitle medium; body copy regular) while keeping existing layout intact.
Adjust the main page heading/subheading styles to match the hierarchy (h1 semibold; subtitle medium; avoid using extra-bold) and ensure body text remains regular.
